message.content:
Step 1. Calculate the Debt to Asset Ratio.
• Debt is represented by the liabilities on the balance sheet. In this problem only current liabilities are given:
 Accounts Payable = 1,000,000.00 
 Taxes Payable = 903,121.89 
 Total Liabilities = 1,903,121.89 
• Total Assets at period end = 31,154,033.87 
 Debt to Asset Ratio = Total Liabilities / Total Assets = 1,903,121.89 / 31,154,033.87 ≈ 0.0611 
 Rounded to two decimals, the Debt to Asset Ratio is 0.06.

Step 2. Calculate the Gross Profit Margin.
• From the income statement:
 Gross Profit = 4,962,437.45 
 Total Revenue = 18,062,437.45 
 Gross Profit Margin = (Gross Profit / Total Revenue) × 100 = (4,962,437.45 / 18,062,437.45) × 100 ≈ 27.49%
 We report the result as 27.49%.

Step 3. Calculate the Operating Cash Flow Ratio.
• From the cash flow statement:
 Net Cash Flow from Operating Activities = –13,358,400.82 
• Current Liabilities (from the balance sheet) = 1,903,121.89 
 Operating Cash Flow Ratio = Operating Cash Flow / Total Current Liabilities 
 = –13,358,400.82 / 1,903,121.89 ≈ –7.017 
 Rounded to two decimals, this ratio is –7.02.

Thus, the final solution is:

{
  "solution": {
    "Debt to Asset Ratio": "0.06",
    "Gross Profit Margin": "27.49%",
    "Operating Cash Flow Ratio": "-7.02"
  }
}
